title.narrative: Sustainable Landscape Program in the Paraguayan Chaco

description.narrative: In the Chaco region in Paraguay, we piloted landscape solutions by small scale, mostly indigenous dairy farmers to cope with drought and floods, increase productivity, reduce GHG emissions, and improve food security. Investment consortiums were set up to finance these solutions. Indigenous communities are experiencing an unprecedented participation in the decision making process that affects their livelihoods, the support helped to overcome the heavy floods in 2019 that damaged large parts of their harvests. The pilots demonstrated that GHG emissions reduced by 31%, and dairy productivity improved by 17%. This motivated the main buyer, Menonite Cooperative Chortitzer to start replicating the production models through their own technicians. We held dialogues with the Agricultural Credit, and a first group of small scale dairy farmers got access to credit to invest in the good practices, and the all producers received financial education training to better manage their finance, generate savings and plan their investments.
